meanings.definition: A person who is excessively proper or precise in their manners and behavior.
meanings.sent1: The prig always insisted on following every rule to the letter.
meanings.sent2: She was often called a prig because of her strict adherence to etiquette.
meanings.sent3: The prig at the party refused to dance, claiming it was improper.
meanings.sent4: His prig-like behavior made him stand out in the laid-back crowd.
meanings.sent5: The image of the prig meticulously arranging his silverware stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To behave or speak in a self-righteous or moralistic manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't prig about how others choose to spend their time.
meanings.sent2: She tends to prig about the importance of punctuality.
meanings.sent3: He would prig about the benefits of eating organic food.
meanings.sent4: Stop prigging about the proper way to load the dishwasher!
meanings.sent5: The politician continued to prig about his opponent's past mistakes.
